recipe_xml:
<recipe>
  <title>Pasta with Lentil Bolognese</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 small onion</ingredient>
    <ingredient>chopped'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 small carrot</ingredient>
    <ingredient>chopped'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 stalk celery</ingredient>
    <ingredient>chopped'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'4 garlic cloves</ingredient>
    <ingredient>minced'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/2 teaspoons tomato paste'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 (16-ounce) cans whole peeled plum tomatoes</ingredient>
    <ingredient>drained and roughly chopped (juice reserved)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/4 cups dried French green lentils'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Coarse sea or kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 pound shaped pasta</ingredient>
    <ingredient>such as cavatappi</ingredient>
    <ingredient>rigatoni</ingredient>
    <ingredient>or ziti'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Pecorino cheese</ingredient>
    <ingredient>grated or shaved'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Fresh basil</ingredient>
    <ingredient>chopped (optional)']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. In a large pot over medium heat, warm the olive oil. Add the onion, carrot, celery, and garlic and cook slowly until the vegetables soften and turn golden, about 20 minutes.</step>
    <step>2. Increase heat to medium-high and add the tomato paste. Cook until the mixture dries out a bit, about 3 minutes. Pour in the reserved juice from the tomatoes and cook, scraping the browned bits from the bottom of the pan, until the liquid has reduced by half, 1 to 2 minutes.</step>
    <step>3. Stir in the lentils, tomatoes, and 1 cup water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat. Season with the salt and pepper and simmer until the lentils are tender, 30 minutes to 1 hour, depending on the lentils. (If the sauce begins to dry out, add additional water as needed.) Reduce heat to low and keep warm.</step>
    <step>4. Cook the pasta according to the package directions</step>
    <step>5. drain. Serve with the lentil sauce, sprinkle with the pecorino, and garnish with the basil, if desired.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Chioggia Beets with Raspberry Mint Vinaigrette</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['1 lb beets (4 to 6; preferably Chioggia*)</ingredient>
    <ingredient>1 inch of stems left intact'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 tablespoons thinly sliced scallions'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 to 2 1/2 tablespoons raspberry vinegar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice</ingredient>
    <ingredient>or to taste'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons chopped fresh mint'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tablespoon finely grated fresh orange zest (from 2 oranges)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 teaspoon salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 teaspoon black pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup olive oil'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'garnish: fresh mint sprigs']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Cover beets with water by 1 inch in a 2- to 3-quart saucepan and simmer until tender when pierced in center with a fork, about 30 minutes. Drain in a colander and rinse under cold running water. Let stand until cool enough to handle, then slip off and discard skins. Cut beets into 1/4-inch-thick slices.</step>
    <step>2. While beets are cooking, stir together scallions, 2 tablespoons vinegar, lemon juice to taste, mint, zest, salt, and pepper in a bowl. Add oil in a slow stream, whisking until combined. Add warm beets and toss with vinaigrette and vinegar and salt to taste. Serve warm or slightly chilled.</step>
    <step>3. *Sometimes called candy-cane beets, chioggias become more aggressive in flavor as they age, so search out relatively young beets, with a diameter of 1 1/2 to 2 inches.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Berry and Ricotta Slice</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['400g ricotta'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'125g reduced-fat cream cheese'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 eggs'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup (60ml) lemon juice'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 teaspoons vanilla extract'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tablespoon rice flour'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup (110g) caster (superfine) sugar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Fresh berries</ingredient>
    <ingredient>to serve']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Preheat oven to 160°C (325°F). Place the ricotta, cream cheese, egg, lemon juice, vanilla, rice flour and sugar in a food processor and process until smooth. Spoon the mixture into a 20cm x 30cm slice tin lined with non-stick baking paper. Bake for 20 minutes or until firm. Refrigerate until cold. Top with fresh berries to serve.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Blade Steaks with Lemon Herb Sauce</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['1 1/2 pounds top blade beef chuck steaks (1/2 to 1 inch thick)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3/4 teaspoon salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 teaspoon black pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'5 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons coarsely chopped fresh oregano'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons coarsely chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 teaspoon grated fresh lemon zest'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon chopped garlic (1 clove)']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Pat steaks dry and cut 3 slits (1 inch long and 1/4 inch deep) 1 inch apart across center cartilage of each steak (to keep from curling), then sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.</step>
    <step>2. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a 12-inch heavy skillet over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking, then cook steaks, turning over once, until meat is just medium-rare, 4 to 7 minutes total.</step>
    <step>3. While steaks cook, pulse herbs with zest, lemon juice, garlic, and remaining 1/4 cup oil, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper in a food processor until finely chopped.</step>
    <step>4. Transfer steaks to a platter and let stand, loosely covered with foil, 5 minutes, then serve with sauce.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Potato and Pea Salad with Chive Aïoli</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['3 pounds small red-skinned new potatoes</ingredient>
    <ingredient>unpeeled'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 tablespoons white wine vinegar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 celery stalks</ingredient>
    <ingredient>thinly sliced'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/2 cups frozen green peas</ingredient>
    <ingredient>thawed'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 cup mayonnaise'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'6 tablespoons chopped fresh chives'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tablespoon Dijon mustard'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 garlic cloves</ingredient>
    <ingredient>pressed'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Cook potatoes in large pot of boiling salted water until just tender, about 25 minutes. Drain</step>
    <step>2. cool. Cut potatoes into quarters. Transfer to large bowl</step>
    <step>3. add vinegar and toss to coat. Mix in celery and peas.</step>
    <step>4. Whisk mayonnaise, 5 tablespoons chives, mustard, garlic, and cayenne pepper in small bowl to blend. Add to potato mixture and toss. Season generously with salt and pepper. Cover and chill at least 1 hour to allow flavors to blend. (Can be made 1 day ahead. Keep refrigerated.) Sprinkle with remaining 1 tablespoon chives and serve.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Parsley, Celery Leaf, and Jicama Salad</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['3 tablespoons fresh lemon juice'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/2 tablespoons rice vinegar (not seasoned)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/2 tablespoons sugar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3/4 teaspoon kosher salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 tablespoons olive oil'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3/4 pound jicama</ingredient>
    <ingredient>peeled and cut into thin matchsticks'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 cups flat-leaf parsley leaves (from 2 bunches)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 cups celery leaves (from about 2 bunches)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'6 scallions</ingredient>
    <ingredient>thinly sliced'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/2 cups radish sprouts (from a 3-ounces package)']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Whisk together lemon juice, vinegar, sugar, and kosher salt in a large bowl until sugar and salt have dissolved, then whisk in oil until well blended.</step>
    <step>2. Add jicama, parsley and celery leaves, scallions, and sprouts and toss to coat. Serve immediately.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Mustard-Crusted Boneless Prime Rib Roast with Cream Sauce</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['1 (6-pound) boneless prime rib roast</ingredient>
    <ingredient>trimmed</ingredient>
    <ingredient>tied'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'4 tablespoons store-bought or homemade Montreal-style steak seasoning</ingredient>
    <ingredient>divided'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 cup sour cream'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup prepared horseradish'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup Dijon mustard</ingredient>
    <ingredient>divided'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup (1/2 stick) melted unsalted butter']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Season roast all over with 2 Tbsp. steak seasoning. Transfer to a wire rack set inside a rimmed baking sheet and let sit at room temperature 1 hour.</step>
    <step>2. Preheat oven to 225°F. Roast beef until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center registers 120°F, 3 1/2–4 hours (start checking every 5–10 minutes after 3 1/2 hours). Tent with foil and let sit at least 30 minutes and up to 1 hour. Increase oven temperature to 500°F.</step>
    <step>3. Meanwhile, whisk sour cream, horseradish, pepper, salt, and 1/4 cup mustard in a small bowl</step>
    <step>4. set aside.</step>
    <step>5. Remove string from roast</step>
    <step>6. discard. Stir butter and remaining 1/4 cup mustard in another small bowl. Using a pastry brush, thickly coat roast with mustard-butter sauce. Coat with remaining 2 Tbsp. steak seasoning. Roast beef until a brown crust forms, 5-10 minutes. Transfer to a cutting board and carve. Serve with sour cream sauce alongside.</step>
    <step>7. Sour cream sauce can be made 1 day ahead. Transfer to an airtight container and chill.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Sour Cream Apple Pie</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['Pastry dough'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 large eggs'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/2 cups sour cream'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/3 cups sugar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 tablespoons plus 1/3 cup all-purpose flour'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 teaspoon salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 pound granny Smith apples'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon cinnamon'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 stick (1/4 cup) cold unsalted butter</ingredient>
    <ingredient>cut into 1/2-inch cubes']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Roll out dough on a lightly floured surface with a lightly floured rolling pin into a 13-inch round (1/8 inch thick), then fit into a 9-inch metal pie plate. Trim edge, leaving a 1/2-inch overhang, then fold overhang under and crimp edge decoratively. Chill shell 30 minutes.</step>
    <step>2. While shell chills, put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 400°F.</step>
    <step>3. Whisk together eggs, sour cream, vanilla, 1 cup sugar, 3 tablespoons flour, nutmeg, and salt in a bowl until smooth. Peel and core apples, then cut into wedges slightly less than 1/4 inch thick. Arrange apples in pie shell, then pour sour cream mixture evenly over them, coating all apples.</step>
    <step>4. Bake pie 15 minutes, then reduce oven temperature to 350°F and bake until filling is puffed and golden and apples are tender, 45 to 50 minutes.</step>
    <step>5. While pie bakes, stir together remaining 1/3 cup sugar, remaining 1/3 cup flour, cinnamon, and a pinch of salt in a bowl, then blend in butter with your fingertips until mixture forms small clumps.</step>
    <step>6. Remove pie from oven and increase oven temperature to 400°F. Crumble topping evenly over top and bake until sugar is melted, about 10 minutes. Cool pie on a rack at least 45 minutes. Serve warm or at room temperature.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Crab Cakes</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['2 slices firm white sandwich bread'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 pound jumbo lump crabmeat</ingredient>
    <ingredient>picked over'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoon mayonnaise'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 large egg</ingredient>
    <ingredient>beaten'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoon unsalted butter'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'lemon wedges']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Tear bread into small pieces into a bowl with crab. Add mayonnaise, Worcestershire sauce, 2 Tbsp egg (discard remainder), and a pinch of salt. Mix together gently but thoroughly, then form into 4 patties (about 3 inches in diameter).</step>
    <step>2. Heat butter in a 12-inch heavy skillet over medium heat until foam subsides, then cook crab cakes, turning once, until golden brown, about 6 minutes total.</step>
    <step>3. french fries and/or baby greens tossed with lemon vinaigrette.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Hoisin-Marinated Pork Chops</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['1 1/2 cups plus 2 tablespoons hoisin sauce'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 cup oyster sauce'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup black bean garlic sauce'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 garlic cloves</ingredient>
    <ingredient>chopped'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tablespoon chopped peeled fresh ginger'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon red food coloring'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'6 12- to 14-ounce pork rib chops</ingredient>
    <ingredient>each about 1 1/2 inches thick']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Mix first 6 ingredients in large bowl for marinade. Place chops in extra-large resealable plastic bag. Add marinade to bag. Seal top, releasing excess air. Turn bag to coat chops. Refrigerate 3 to 5 days, turning bag occasionally.</step>
    <step>2. Preheat broiler, adjusting rack 8 inches below heat source. Line rimmed baking sheet with heavy-duty foil. Remove chops from marinade. Place chops on prepared pan with some marinade still clinging. Broil until chops are cooked through and thermometer inserted horizontally into center registers 145°F, watching closely to prevent burning (chops may char slightly in spots), about 9 minutes per side. Transfer to plates and serve.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Turkey Enchiladas</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['2 (28-ounce) cans whole</ingredient>
    <ingredient>peeled San Marzano tomatoes</ingredient>
    <ingredient>drained and seeded'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 large onions</ingredient>
    <ingredient>roughly chopped'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'8 dried ancho chiles</ingredient>
    <ingredient>* seeds removed'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'20 dried arbol chiles</ingredient>
    <ingredient>seeds removed'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'4 heads garlic</ingredient>
    <ingredient>cloves separated and peeled'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 stalks celery</ingredient>
    <ingredient>roughly chopped'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 large carrots</ingredient>
    <ingredient>roughly chopped'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'4 tablespoons whole coriander seeds'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons whole cumin seeds'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons whole dill seeds'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Fine sea salt and freshly ground black pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Your favorite roast turkey or 2 roast chickens'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 tablespoons unsalted butter</ingredient>
    <ingredient>softened</ingredient>
    <ingredient>for greasing the baking dish'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'About 4 cups pulled cooked turkey (from roast turkey) or chicken (from 2 roast chickens)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'8 (12-inch) flour tortillas'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 cups grated queso fresco**'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 cups shredded queso Chihuahua***'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Sour cream'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'limes</ingredient>
    <ingredient>cut into wedges'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'*Dried chiles are often quite spicy and can leave their heat on your hands so some cooks like to wear rubber gloves when working with them. Be careful not to touch your eyes.'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'**Queso fresco is a mild</ingredient>
    <ingredient>grainy Mexican cheese available at many supermarkets. Cotija and feta are good substitutes.'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'***Queso Chihuahua is a stringy</ingredient>
    <ingredient>melting Mexican cheese. If unavailable</ingredient>
    <ingredient>use mozzarella.'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Equipment: 1 large roasting pan; food processor or blender; 2 (9- by 13-inch) baking dishes']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. In a large bowl, combine the tomatoes, onions, ancho and arbol chiles, garlic, celery, carrots, coriander, cumin, and dill and stir to combine. Season with salt and pepper then transfer to the roasting pan you will roast the turkey in.</step>
    <step>2. Roast the turkey according to your recipe. As the turkey roasts, its juices and fat will drip down and cook the enchilada sauce ingredients. (Keep in mind that if you baste the turkey with the turkey juices, they'll be flavored with your enchilada sauce ingredients. To avoid flavoring your turkey this way, baste with melted butter, turkey or chicken stock, or low-sodium chicken broth—or a combination of these.)</step>
    <step>3. When you remove the turkey from the oven to rest, check to see that the vegetables are tender and if necessary return them to the oven to finish cooking.</step>
    <step>4. Working in batches, transfer the enchilada mixture to a food processor or blender and process until smooth—if necessary, use a few splashes of water to loosen or thin the mixture and create a smooth paste. Season with salt and pepper. DO AHEAD: The enchilada sauce can be prepared ahead and refrigerated, in an airtight container, up to 3 days, or frozen, up to 3 months.</step>
    <step>5. Preheat the oven to 350°F and butter 2 (9- by 13-inch) baking dishes. Spread about 1 cup of the enchilada sauce in the bottom of each dish.</step>
    <step>6. Pick the meat off the leftover turkey carcass and transfer to a large bowl—you'll need about 4 cups of meat. Add half the remaining enchilada sauce, along with half the queso fresco and half the queso Chihuahua, and stir to combine.</step>
    <step>7. On a work surface, spread about 1 cup of the turkey filling on the bottom half of 1 tortilla and roll it up burrito-style, folding in the sides to seal them closed. Repeat with the remaining tortillas and filling. Arrange the enchiladas tightly in the 2 prepared baking dishes then cover with the remaining sauce, followed by the remaining queso fresco and queso Chihuahua. DO AHEAD: The turkey enchiladas can be assembled up to this point, covered, and refrigerated, up to 24 hours, or frozen up to 3 months.</step>
    <step>8. Cover the enchiladas with foil and bake until the cheese has melted and the sauce is thickened and dark, about 1 hour. Serve immediately with sour cream and limes.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Almond-Pear Galette</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['1 1/4 cups all-purpose flour</ingredient>
    <ingredient>plus extra for rolling and dusting'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons sugar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 teaspoon baking powder'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 teaspoon salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/8 teaspoon baking soda'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'5 tablespoons butter</ingredient>
    <ingredient>cut into 1/2-inch cubes and frozen'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoon cultured buttermilk'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 teaspoon pure almond extract'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 large egg white'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>"3 tablespoons confectioners' sugar"</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 tablespoons finely ground almonds'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 teaspoons melted butter'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 teaspoon pure almond extract'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 firm</ingredient>
    <ingredient>ripe pears</ingredient>
    <ingredient>such as Anjou or Bartlett'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoon fresh lemon juice'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/2 teaspoons grated lemon zest'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 sheets parchment paper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup granulated sugar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 teaspoon cinnamon'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 teaspoons butter</ingredient>
    <ingredient>cut into small bits'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>"Confectioners' sugar for dusting"]</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Pulse flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, and baking soda in a food processor 30 seconds to combine. Add butter. Pulse until butter pieces are the size of peas. Add buttermilk and almond extract</step>
    <step>2. pulse until dough just comes together. Form dough into a disk, dusting lightly with flour. Cover in plastic wrap or wax paper and refrigerate 1 hour.</step>
    <step>3. Whisk egg white and confectioners' sugar in a bowl until frothy, about 1 minute. Add almonds, butter and almond extract. Whisk. Refrigerate.</step>
    <step>4. Peel and core pears, then cut into slices about 1/4 inch thick</step>
    <step>5. toss in a bowl with lemon juice and zest.</step>
    <step>6. Heat oven to 400°F. Lightly dust a sheet of parchment paper with flour</step>
    <step>7. place dough on top and lightly dust with flour</step>
    <step>8. top with another sheet of parchment and roll out dough into a circle about 12 inches in diameter. Peel off top layer of parchment. Invert dough onto a baking sheet lined with third sheet of parchment. Trim around edges of dough. Spread cream over dough, leaving a 1-inch border. Arrange pear slices in concentric circles over cream. Sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon. Fold edges of dough over pears, crimping dough to enclose ends of pears. Evenly scatter bits of butter over top of filling. Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until pears are tender and crust is golden. (Cover top with a sheet of foil if it begins to overbrown.) Remove</step>
    <step>9. cover edges of tart with foil. Heat broiler. Glaze top of pears under broiler, about 6 inches from heat, 1 minute or until pears are golden brown. Cool on baking sheet 5 minutes. Transfer (on parchment) to rack to cool completely. Dust with confectioners' sugar.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Lemon-Raspberry French Toast Strata</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['1/2 cup pure maple syrup</ingredient>
    <ingredient>plus additional for serving'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'6 cups 1-inch cubes day-old country-style white bread with crusts (about 12 ounces or 3/4 loaf)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 pint fresh raspberries'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'6 large eggs'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'4 cups whole milk'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 teaspoon finely grated lemon zest'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 teaspoon salt']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Arrange rack in center of the oven and preheat to 350°F.</step>
    <step>2. Lightly butter 9- by 13-inch glass baking dish or 14-inch oval gratin dish. Pour in maple syrup</step>
    <step>3. scatter bread cubes and raspberries in dish.</step>
    <step>4. In large bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, lemon zest, and salt</step>
    <step>5. pour over bread cubes.</step>
    <step>6. Bake strata until puffed and golden brown, about 45 minutes. Transfer to rack to cool 5 minutes, then serve warm with additional maple syrup.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Lemon Custard Pie</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['1 1/4 cups graham cracker crumbs (from nine 5-by 2 1/2-inch graham crackers)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 tablespoons sugar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'5 tablespoons unsalted butter</ingredient>
    <ingredient>melted'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 cup sugar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'10 (3- by 1-inch) strips lemon zest (from 2 lemons)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup water'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3/4 cup heavy cream'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Rounded 1/8 teaspoon salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'5 large eggs'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup fresh lemon juice'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Equipment: a 9-inch pie plate (4-cup capacity)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Accompaniment: lightly sweetened whipped cream']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Preheat oven to 350°F with rack in middle. Lightly butter pie plate.</step>
    <step>2. Stir together all crust ingredients, then press onto bottom and up side of pie plate. Bake until crisp, 12 to 15 minutes, then cool completely, about 45 minutes.</step>
    <step>3. Reduce oven temperature to 325°F.</step>
    <step>4. Pulse sugar and zest in a food processor until zest is finely chopped, then transfer to a small heavy saucepan with water. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring until sugar has dissolved, then boil, without stirring, 5 minutes. Stir in cream and salt, then cook until hot (do not let boil).</step>
    <step>5. Whisk eggs in a large bowl. Add hot cream mixture in a slow stream, whisking constantly, then whisk in lemon juice.</step>
    <step>6. Strain custard through a fine sieve into another bowl, then pour into crust.</step>
    <step>7. Bake until filling is set 2 inches from edge but center is still wobbly, 25 to 30 minutes. Cool completely (filling will continue to set as it cools).</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Hirsheimer's Hot & Sweet Mustard</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['3/4 cup (packed) light brown sugar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>"1 4-ounce tin Colman's mustard powder"</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 cup good-quality apple cider vinegar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup honey'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 large eggs</ingredient>
    <ingredient>beaten to blend'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Four clean 4-ounce jars']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Whisk brown sugar and mustard powder in a large bowl to combine. Add vinegar and honey</step>
    <step>2. whisk well. Strain through a fine-mesh sieve into a large metal bowl. Add eggs and whisk until blended.</step>
    <step>3. Set bowl with mustard mixture over a large saucepan of gently simmering water (do not allow bottom of bowl to touch water</step>
    <step>4. eggs may scramble). Cook, whisking and scraping bottom of bowl frequently, until mustard is thick and an instantread thermometer registers 160°F, about 5 minutes.</step>
    <step>5. Divide mustard among jars. Screw on lids and chill. DO AHEAD: Mustard can be made 2 weeks ahead. Keep refrigerated for up to 2 months.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Kohlrabi and Apple Salad with Caraway</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['1 teaspoon caraway seeds'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 tablespoons olive oil'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons white wine vinegar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tablespoon Dijon mustard'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Kosher salt</ingredient>
    <ingredient>freshly ground pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 medium kohlrabi or 1 medium celery root (celeriac)</ingredient>
    <ingredient>peeled</ingredient>
    <ingredient>thinly sliced on a mandoline'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 small heads frisée</ingredient>
    <ingredient>torn into bite-size pieces (about 6 cups)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 crisp red apple (such as Pink lady or Honeycrisp)</ingredient>
    <ingredient>thinly sliced'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'4 tablespoons chopped fresh chives</ingredient>
    <ingredient>divided']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Toast caraway seeds in a small dry skillet over medium heat, tossing often, until fragrant, about 3 minutes. Let cool, then coarsely chop.</step>
    <step>2. Whisk caraway, oil, vinegar, and mustard in a large bowl</step>
    <step>3. season with salt and pepper.</step>
    <step>4. Add kohlrabi, frisée, apple, and 2 tablespoons chives to bowl with dressing and toss to coat</step>
    <step>5. season with salt and pepper.</step>
    <step>6. Top salad with remaining 2 tablespoons chives just before serving.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Thai Beef Salad</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['1 pound (455 g) strip steak (about 1 inch/2.5 cm thick; see Tip)</ingredient>
    <ingredient>trimmed and at room temperature'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Vegetable oil'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Salt and pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 large head of butter lettuce</ingredient>
    <ingredient>also known as Boston or Bibb</ingredient>
    <ingredient>leaves torn into bite-size pieces'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 English cucumber</ingredient>
    <ingredient>halved lengthwise and sliced'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 pint (120 g) cherry tomatoes</ingredient>
    <ingredient>halved'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 small red onion</ingredient>
    <ingredient>halved lengthwise and thinly sliced'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Handful of fresh mint leaves</ingredient>
    <ingredient>roughly chopped'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'large handful of fresh cilantro leaves</ingredient>
    <ingredient>roughly chopped'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Chile-lime Sauce'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Handful of roasted peanuts</ingredient>
    <ingredient>whole or roughly chopped (optional)']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Preheat the broiler, with a rack positioned so that the meat will be 3 to 4 inches (7.5 to 10 cm) from the heat. Line the bottom of a broiler pan with foil for easier clean-up, if you like, then top with the broiler rack. Put the meat on the broiler rack, lightly coat with the oil, and season with salt and pepper. Broil the meat for 5 to 7 minutes per side for medium-rare (err on the side of caution with the time</step>
    <step>2. you can always cook it more). Transfer to a cutting board, sprinkle with salt, and let rest for 5 to 10 minutes.</step>
    <step>3. Meanwhile, in a large bowl, combine the lettuce, cucumbers, tomatoes, onions, mint, and cilantro.*</step>
    <step>4. Cut the meat against the grain into very thin slices and add to the bowl. (If the meat is still hot, wait a few minutes until it is warm or it will wilt the lettuce and herbs.) Drizzle the salad with just enough Chile-Lime Sauce to lightly coat and gently toss together. Top with the peanuts, if you like.</step>
    <step>5. Prepare to *, then cover and refrigerate the lettuce mixture and the unsliced meat separately for up to 1 day. The meat can be sliced and added to the salad cold or you can warm it in a 300°F (150°C) oven, if you prefer.</step>
    <step>6. If the salad will be served within 1 hour or so, cover the lettuce mixture and meat separately and leave them on the counter. People can help themselves and then toss their individual portions with the dressing.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>BLT Wraps with Horseradish Mayonnaise</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['2 oz country-style bread</ingredient>
    <ingredient>preferably day-old</ingredient>
    <ingredient>torn into 1" pieces (about 1 1/2 cups)'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 lb. thick-cut bacon'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 tsp kosher salt</ingredient>
    <ingredient>plus more'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup mayonnaise'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tbsp finely grated lemon zest'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'4 tsp fresh lemon juice'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tsp prepared horseradish'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 tsp freshly ground black pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'3 heads of little gem lettuce</ingredient>
    <ingredient>leaves separated</ingredient>
    <ingredient>covered</ingredient>
    <ingredient>chilled'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 pint cherry tomatoes</ingredient>
    <ingredient>halved'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 cup basil leaves'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'lemon wedges (for serving)']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Place a rack in middle of oven</step>
    <step>2. preheat to 350°F. Spread out torn bread on a rimmed baking sheet. Set a wire rack in baking sheet over bread and arrange bacon on rack (it’s okay if strips overlap a bit</step>
    <step>3. they’ll shrink as they cook). This setup will crisp the bacon, and as the bread becomes enriched with some of the drippings, it will get nice and toasty. Bake 20 minutes. Remove from oven and turn bacon. Carefully tilt baking sheet to pour off any fat into a small bowl</step>
    <step>4. reserve for another use if desired. Return to oven and bake until bacon is brown and crisp and breadcrumbs are golden brown, about 20 minutes more. Transfer bacon and toasted breadcrumbs to separate paper towels to drain.</step>
    <step>5. Slide breadcrumbs, still on paper towels, to a cutting board and crush into very small pieces with a flat-bottomed measuring cup. Season with salt, place on a small plate or in a small bowl, and set aside for serving.</step>
    <step>6. Meanwhile, whisk mayonnaise, lemon zest, lemon juice, horseradish, pepper, and 1/2 tsp. salt in a small bowl to combine</step>
    <step>7. set aside.</step>
    <step>8. Arrange bacon, lettuce leaves, tomatoes, basil, and lemon wedges on a platter or on a couple of plates and in bowls so that each component is visible and easily accessible. Set out kitchen shears next to bacon for cutting to size. Serve with breadcrumbs and reserved horseradish mayonnaise (for spreading over lettuce).</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Rib-Eye, T-Bone, and Strip Steaks Cut Over One Inch</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['Four-six bone-in or boneless rib-eye</ingredient>
    <ingredient>T-bone</ingredient>
    <ingredient>and/or strip steaks cut over 1"'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Sea salt or kosher salt'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Freshly ground black pepper'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Canola oil or vegetable oil'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup olive oil'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'4 tbsp unsalted butter'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'10 crushed garlic cloves'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup finely chopped savory herbs such as rosemary</ingredient>
    <ingredient>thyme</ingredient>
    <ingredient>marjoram</ingredient>
    <ingredient>oregano</ingredient>
    <ingredient>and/or sage'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'6 tbsp olive oil'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tbsp finely chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Sea or kosher salt to taste'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Freshly ground black pepper to taste']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Generously season the steaks with salt and pepper. Press in the seasoning, and dab the meat onto the board to collect any excess.</step>
    <step>2. Glisten the meat with canola oil, using the first steak to brush oil onto the others.</step>
    <step>3. Preheat the BBQ to medium-high.</step>
    <step>4. Combine the baste ingredients in a foil pan or heatproof pan and warm on the side of the grill.</step>
    <step>5. Put the meat on the well-oiled grill and cook until medium-rare (or cook to desired doneness).</step>
    <step>6. Baste regularly, stacking and/or flipping the meat if the flames get out of control.</step>
    <step>7. When the steaks are nicely caramelized and charred on both sides, approximately 15 to 25 minutes total, they are done. (You can check the temp with an instant-read thermometer if that is more comfortable</step>
    <step>8. the steaks should register 125°F).</step>
    <step>9. Combine the board dressing ingredients.</step>
    <step>10. Let the steaks rest for 2 minutes, then pour the board dressing onto a cutting board and slice the steaks, turning to coat the slices.</step>
    <step>11. *When steaks come off the grill looking all charred and gorgeous, it'll be tough to resist digging in right away. But letting them rest is essential. Otherwise, a lot of the lovely, tasty juices will spill out when you slice in.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>

<recipe>
  <title>Herbed Bean Salad</title>
  <ingredients>
    <ingredient>['1 1/2 pounds tender green beans</ingredient>
    <ingredient>stem ends snapped'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1 1/2 pounds tender wax beans</ingredient>
    <ingredient>stem ends snapped'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablespoons finely minced shallots'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'Salt and pepper</ingredient>
    <ingredient>to taste'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'2 tablebspoons red-wine vinegar'</ingredient>
    <ingredient>'1/2 cup torn fresh basil leaves']</ingredient>
  </ingredients>
  <instructions>
    <step>1. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the beans and cook until just tender, 4 to 5 minutes. Drain and run under cold water to stop the cooking process. Drain again and pat dry. Place in a large bowl.</step>
    <step>2. Toss with the shallots and oil. Season with salt and pepper.</step>
    <step>3. Just before serving, toss beans with the vinegar. Toss with the basil. Serve.</step>
  </instructions>
</recipe>
